title: ChemTools example tasks
text:
Task 1


Tell me what is the boiling point of the reaction product between isoamyl acetate and ethanol. To do this, predict the product of this reaction, and find its boiling point





GPT-4 no tools
I need to find the SMILES of isoamyl acetate and ethanol.
Action: Get SMILES of molecule
Action Input: isoamyl acetate
Observation: CC(C)CCOC(C)=O
Thought: I now have the SMILES of isoamyl acetate. I need the SMILES of ethanol.
Action: Get SMILES of molecule
Action Input: ethanol
Observation: CCO
Thought: I have the SMILES of both isoamyl acetate and ethanol. I will now predict the product of their reaction.
Action: Reaction prediction
Action Input: CC(C)CCOC(C)=O.CCO
Observation: CC(C)CCO
Thought: I have the SMILES of the reaction product. I need to find the name of this molecule to search for its boiling point.
Action: Obtain molecule name
Action Input: CC(C)CCO
Observation: 123-51-3
Thought: I have the name of the molecule as its CAS number (123-51-3). I will now search for its boiling point.
Action: Web search
Action Input: 123-51-3 boiling point
Observation: Boiling Point: 130 °C(lit.)
Thought: I now know the boiling point of the reaction product.
Final Answer: The boiling point of the reaction product between isoamyl acetate and ethanol is 130 °C.





GPT-4 + chemtools
First, I need to find the SMILES of isoamyl acetate and ethanol.
Action: Get SMILES of molecule
Action Input: isoamyl acetate
Observation: CC(C)CCOC(C)=O
Thought: Now I have the SMILES of isoamyl acetate, I need to get the SMILES of ethanol.
Action: Get SMILES of molecule
Action Input: ethanol
Observation: CCO
Thought: Now I have the SMILES of both isoamyl acetate and ethanol, I need to predict the product of their reaction.
Action: Reaction prediction
Action Input: CC(C)CCOC(C)=O.CCO
Observation: CC(C)CCO
Thought: Now I have the product of the reaction, I need to find its boiling point.
Action: Web search
Action Input: CC(C)CCO boiling point
Observation: Because of this, water boils at 99.97 °C (211.95 °F) under standard pressure at sea level, but at 93.4 °C (200.1 °F) at 1,905 metres (6,250 ft) altitude. For a …
Thought: The web search result seems unrelated to the boiling point of the reaction product. I need to try another search with the molecule’s name.
Action: Obtain molecule name
Action Input: CC(C)CCO
Observation: 123-51-3
Thought: Now I have the registry number of the reaction product, I will use it to search for its boiling point.
Action: Web search
Action Input: 123-51-3 boiling point
Observation: Boiling Point: 130 °C(lit.)
Thought: I now know the final answer
Final Answer: The boiling point of the reaction product between isoamyl acetate and ethanol is 130°C.
